answers.answer: Yep if you fail this one I think it would mean gestational diabetes idk see what your dr says
That happened with my first pregnancy. That test *****. But I passed my 3 hour & had no problems.  So there is still a chance everything is fine.  :)
Oh.  I can't say s*cks. Lol
What I have to do to pass it?? Is it very serious?

I don't think there is anything you can do, it's just how your body is processing sugars... I did cut down on my sugar intake tho before the long test. I was only one point over my 1hr. If you do fail the second test is nothing too serious I don't think.  You'll have to watch your diet & be more active, maybe medication.  & could have a larger baby.  I'm not sure all the affects.  It'll be ok tho! :) :)
Okay does it affect my baby ?? She going to still be normal?
I don't know exactly.  I don't think it will hurt your baby.  :) your doctor should have more accurate information for you.
The glucose test is for gestational diabetes, you can google some info on that. But don't believe everything you read, your Dr is the best person to discuss it with.
If you end up having GD, your Dr will recommend a diet to keep it under control. Your baby will be fine as long as you take care of yourself.
I also fauled glucose test on first pregnancy now im 5 weeks pregnant a year later fingers crossed I pass it this time

I failed my 1h test and they sent me for the 2 hr one and i passed. Sometimes the 1hr isnt very accurate. If ur not classed as high risk they send u for a 1hr firat and then for the longer one if u fail the 1hr one. Its pretty common to faul the 1 hr and pass the longer test. Dont stress
Yes gestational diabetes can affect your baby.  It can cause imbalances

question: failed my 1 hour glucose test what does this mean ??? Now I got to do a 3hrs glucose test❗️
title: FAILED
